title.narrative: 10 Communication for Development (C4D) - COVID-19

description.narrative: Men, women and children are reached with COVID-19 specific messages through risk communication and community engagement interventions., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: India Country Programme is effectively and efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Men, women and children are reached with COVID-19 specific messages through risk communication and community engagementinterventions.

description.narrative: In response to COVID-19, RCCE (Risk Communication and Community Engagement) strategy has been implemented across 22 states. The intensive communication interventions have supported COVID appropriate behaviors and vaccine uptake by addressing vaccine hesitancy issues. As of December 2021, India crossed 1.34 billion COVID-19 vaccinations with around 51% full vaccination coverage among target population. More than 76-million people were reached and engaged with COVID Appropriate Behaviours CAB, Vaccine Comms. Targeted campaigns were organised by 1,300 temporary social mobilisers, 297 consultants in 426. Over 500,000 frontline workers, CSOs and youths have been trained to engage communities with CABs and vaccine messages. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
